item.title: Ultra Detailed Topographic CNC Carvings
item.description: Mount St. Helens hillshade This article might get too technical in places with all the CNC, CAM, CAD, GIS terminology. To spare your time here’s the TLDR: TLDR More than 6 month ago something clicked and I got all enthusiastic about maps and topography. 2D renders were all nice and cool but real 3D topographic sculpts would really elevate the data to a higher level. Turns out it’s hard to make detailed models and there are quite a few reasons why nobody (at least documented online) seems to have a solid working process.
